support_summary: ATXN3 interacts with STUB1 (also known as CHIP) when monoubiquitinated, suggesting a role in protein quality control and degradation pathways.

functions.cellular_process: ATXN3 is recruited to the E3 ligase STUB1/CHIP and, through its deubiquitinase activity, limits the length of ubiquitin chains being attached to chaperone-bound substrates.
functions.effect_description: By trimming the ubiquitin chains as they are being built on substrates, ATXN3 modulates the degradation signal, ensuring proper substrate processing by the proteasome.
biological_consequence: ATXN3 binds STUB1/CHIP-substrate complex → ATXN3 edits and restricts ubiquitin chain length on the substrate → Substrate is targeted for proteasomal degradation with a modified ubiquitin signal
specific_effects: This collaborative E3/DUB activity represents a key regulatory point in ubiquitin-dependent protein quality control.

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP

functions.cellular_process: After substrate ubiquitination is complete, ATXN3 deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP itself, effectively terminating the ubiquitination reaction.
functions.effect_description: This action serves as a termination signal for the ubiquitination cycle, resetting the STUB1/CHIP E3 ligase for subsequent reactions.
biological_consequence: Substrate ubiquitination is completed → ATXN3 deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP → The ubiquitination reaction is terminated → STUB1/CHIP is recycled

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP

mechanism: ATXN3 is recruited to the E3 ligase STUB1/CHIP and, through its deubiquitinase activity, limits the length of ubiquitin chains being attached to chaperone-bound substrates. After substrate ubiquitination is complete, ATXN3 deubiquitinates STUB1/CHIP itself, effectively terminating the ubiquitination reaction.
effect: By trimming the ubiquitin chains as they are being built on substrates, ATXN3 modulates the degradation signal, ensuring proper substrate processing by the proteasome.; This action serves as a termination signal for the ubiquitination cycle, resetting the STUB1/CHIP E3 ligase for subsequent reactions.
summary: ATXN3 inhibits STUB1 to regulate substrate polyubiquitination chain elongation and stub1/chip e3 ligase activity, ultimately affecting substrate is targeted for proteasomal degradation with a modified ubiquitin signal.

evidence.paper_title: Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP
Collaborates with ATXN3 in the degradation of misfolded chaperone substrates: ATXN3 restricting the length of ubiquitin chain attached to STUB1/CHIP substrates and preventing further chain extension.
Ube2w and ataxin-3 coordinately regulate the ubiquitin ligase CHIP
